text:
Could the CSS combinator/minifier please not remove spaces from around + signs? Thank you
If I stick a rule like `clamp(3.2rem, 1.42448979592rem + 7.58vw, 9rem)` I'll get an invalid property value and the workaround is to stick `calc()` around the preferred size calculation.
It seems like it doesn't happen if I `<style>` it inline in a template but parsing the css breaks it.

For other agency devs/people that work in multiple portals:

Anyone else get super frustrated when asking for portal permissions and "Super Admin" isn't an option? Wouldn't it be way easier to simply "request access" in HubSpot itself a la Google Docs instead of detailing every tab and toggle for your clients to activate?

If you agree, I'd love some upvotes over here: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Create-a-quot-Request-Access-Permissions-quot-Function-for-New/idi-p/380989#M67048>

The module usage snippet does not contain any of the default field option values. So if you want to override you need to do some cross referencing. It would be nice if the embed snippet contained the default values so we could quickly override if necessary. Or give the option to copy a verbose version. <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Module-Template-Usage-Snippet-to-Include-All-Options/idi-p/381007#M67054>
